intro: Delima aspera, commonly known as the rough delima, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
